Context: Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.
Question: If Kyle and Lenore do not give reports, then the morning reports on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, respectively, could be given by
Choices:
  A: Helen, George, and Nina
  B: Irving, Robert, and Helen
  C: Nina, Helen, and Olivia
  D: Olivia, Robert, and Irving
  E: Robert, George, and Helen
Reflection:
You previously answered this question incorrectly.
Then you reflected on the problem, your solution, and the correct answer.
Use your self-reflection (below) to help you answer this question.
Any information that you are not allowed to see will be marked [REDACTED].
Advice:
- Always read the question and conditions carefully.
- Do not make assumptions that are not supported by the conditions.
- Evaluate each option systematically.
- Remember that the absence of a condition can also be a valid scenario.
- Practice logical reasoning problems to improve your skills.

Thought: 
Kyle and Lenore are not giving reports. 
George can only give a report on Tuesday. 
Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. 
If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.
Option A: Helen, George, and Nina - This is not possible because if Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports. But Helen has already given a report on Monday.
Option B: Irving, Robert, and Helen - This is not possible because George must give a report on Tuesday, but Robert is scheduled for Tuesday in this option.
Option C: Nina, Helen, and Olivia - This is possible. Nina gives a report on Monday, Helen and Irving give reports on Tuesday (Helen in the morning and Irving in the afternoon), and Olivia gives a report on Wednesday morning. George can give the afternoon report on Tuesday.
Option D: Olivia, Robert, and Irving - This is not possible because George must give a report on Tuesday, but Robert is scheduled for Tuesday in this option.
Option E: Robert, George, and Helen - This is not possible because neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report, but Robert is scheduled for Monday morning, which would require him to give an afternoon report.
Action: Answer("C")
